intro: Microrhynchus acaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often near streams or in dense forests. The plant has a short, unbranched stem and produces small, greenish-white flowers with a distinctive lip. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it relies on specific mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
